page.title: 17A Visit to Ninniss Farm
page.content: Ninniss, in Cornish means secret place and it is here, in the{Boscolla Valley is a farm typical of this part of the block. On the farm is a livery stables where horses are kept by Mrs.Treweek for other horse owners. She looks after 16 horses, feeding and exercising them for their owners who ride them in their leisure time. The horses are used mostly for {eventing, dressage, show jumping}and {cross-country.}The fields around are used for grazing and growing hay for the horses. Being on a slope, the fields are not much use for anything else. The valley is drained by the River{Kenwyn}which is not more than a stream at this point. Other holdings in the valley are mostly involved with the rearing and exercising of horses.
